meanings.sent1: The rabblement outside the stadium caused chaos.
meanings.sent2: The police had to disperse the rabblement that gathered in the square.
meanings.sent3: The noisy rabblement of fans cheered on their team.
meanings.sent4: The rabblement of protesters flooded the streets with their chants.
meanings.sent5: The rabblement of children playing in the park was a joyful sight.

meanings.definition: A group of people regarded as disreputable or worthless.
meanings.sent1: The old building attracted a rabblement of troublemakers.
meanings.sent2: The town's rabblement often caused trouble at the local market.
meanings.sent3: The rabblement of gossipers spread rumors throughout the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The rabblement of outcasts found solace in their shared experiences.
meanings.sent5: The rabblement of misfits formed a tight-knit community.

meanings.sent1: The rabblement at the concert made it hard to hear the music.
meanings.sent2: The street party turned into a rabblement of revelers.
meanings.sent3: The rabblement of children playing tag echoed through the park.
meanings.sent4: The rabblement of fans erupted into cheers as their team scored.
meanings.sent5: The rabblement of protesters grew louder as they marched down the street.
